seasonal_context.typical_patterns: North Pacific storms generate NW swells

buoy_analysis.narrative: Buoy 51001 (NW Hawaii) shows strong NW swell signal building since 06:00 HST. Wave heights increased from 8ft @ 14s to 12ft @ 16s over 6 hours, indicating a well-organized groundswell. Direction steady at 315° (NW). Buoy 51201 (North Shore) confirms with 10ft @ 15s from 320°. Spectral analysis shows clean single-peak energy, no overlapping systems. Cross-buoy timing suggests swell propagating at expected group velocity (~30 kt). High confidence in NW swell arrival and size.

pressure_analysis.narrative: Surface analysis shows deep low-pressure center (968 mb) at 45°N, 165°W on Oct 12, generating NW fetch of 800+ nautical miles. Sustained winds 40-50 kt in fetch window for 24+ hours. Wave period forecast charts show 14-16s energy arriving North Shore on Oct 15-16. No competing systems. High pressure ridge to south will provide favorable offshore winds for North Shore. Pattern matches historical NW swell events with high confidence.

key_findings: Strong agreement between buoy observations and pressure forecast
NW swell building as predicted from Oct 12 storm system
Peak arrival expected Oct 15 afternoon through Oct 16
Favorable offshore winds from high pressure ridge
No competing swell systems - clean NW dominant
